intro: Cryptantha intermedia var. rigida, commonly known as the rigid cryptantha, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and small, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain several seeds. Cryptantha intermedia var. rigida is often found in grasslands and open woodlands, where it contributes to the local biodiversity.
